vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection in User Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: A critical SQL injection vulnerability exists in the user authentication mechanism. An attacker can bypass authentication and gain unauthorized access to the database by manipulating SQL queries through user input fields.
vulnerabilities.evidence: MySQL error: You have an error in your SQL syntax; Query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE username='admin' OR '1'='1' -- ' AND password='...'
vulnerabilities.impact: Complete database compromise, unauthorized access to sensitive user data, potential for privilege escalation and system takeover.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement parameterized queries/prepared statements, validate and sanitize all user inputs, apply principle of least privilege to database accounts.

vulnerabilities.title: Remote Code Execution via File Upload
vulnerabilities.description: The file upload functionality does not properly validate file types, allowing attackers to upload and execute malicious PHP scripts on the server.
vulnerabilities.evidence: Successfully uploaded PHP shell: <?php system($_GET['cmd']); ?> - Command execution confirmed
vulnerabilities.impact: Complete server compromise, ability to execute arbitrary commands, access to sensitive files and databases.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement strict file type validation, use whitelist approach, store uploads outside web root, scan uploaded files for malicious content.

vulnerabilities.title: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.description: User input is reflected in the response without proper encoding, allowing attackers to inject malicious JavaScript code that executes in victims' browsers.
vulnerabilities.evidence: JavaScript alert executed successfully, DOM manipulation confirmed
vulnerabilities.impact: Session hijacking, credential theft, defacement, malicious redirects, keylogging.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper output encoding, use Content Security Policy (CSP), validate and sanitize user inputs.

vulnerabilities.title: Local File Inclusion (LFI)
vulnerabilities.description: The application includes files based on user input without proper validation, allowing attackers to read sensitive system files.
vulnerabilities.impact: Exposure of sensitive system files, configuration files, source code, potential for remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper input validation, use whitelist approach for file inclusion, avoid user-controlled file paths.

vulnerabilities.title: Information Disclosure via Error Messages
vulnerabilities.description: Detailed error messages reveal sensitive information about the system architecture, database structure, and file paths.
vulnerabilities.evidence: MySQL Error: Table 'webapp.users' doesn't exist in database 'production_db' at /var/www/html/includes/database.php:42
vulnerabilities.impact: Information leakage about system architecture, database names, file paths, technology stack.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement custom error pages, log detailed errors server-side only, sanitize error messages for users.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Security Headers
vulnerabilities.description: The application is missing critical security headers that help protect against various attacks.
vulnerabilities.evidence: Missing headers: X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Content-Security-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security
vulnerabilities.impact: Increased risk of clickjacking, MIME type sniffing attacks, XSS attacks, and man-in-the-middle attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement comprehensive security headers: CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, etc.

vulnerabilities.title: Directory Listing Enabled
vulnerabilities.description: Directory listing is enabled on the web server, potentially exposing sensitive files and directory structure.
vulnerabilities.evidence: Directory listing shows: backup.sql, config.php.bak, user_data.csv
vulnerabilities.impact: Information disclosure about file structure, potential exposure of backup files and sensitive data.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Disable directory listing in web server configuration, implement proper access controls.
